sen.j: 京都定期観光バス（きょうとていきかんこうバス）は、京阪バスと京都市交通局が京都市ならびにその周辺地域で運行している定期観光バスである。
sen.e: Kyoto Regular Tour Bus is a regular sightseeing bus which runs by Keihan Bus and Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau in Kyoto City and the area around there.
Kyoto Regular Tour Bus is a regular sightseeing bus operated by Keihan Bus and Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau in Kyoto City and the surrounding area.
Kyoto Regular Tour Bus is a regular sightseeing bus operated by Keihan Bus and Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau in Kyoto City and the surrounding area.

sen.j: 本項では、同じく京都駅を出発し、京阪バスが運営していたびわ湖定期観光バスについてもこの項にて紹介する（びわ湖定期観光バスについては、かつては江若交通も運行に参加していた。
sen.e: This section introduce about Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus which departs from Kyoto Station, managed by Keihan bus (Kojak Bus used to join to run Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus).
sen.cmt: びわ湖定期観光バス→Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus[定訳不明]江若交通→Kojak Bus[同社HPより]
sen.e: This section will introduce the Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus which departs from Kyoto Station, and is managed by Keihan bus (the Kojak Bus used to jointly operate the Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus as well).

This section will introduce the Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus which departs from Kyoto Station, and is managed by Keihan bus (the Kojak Bus used to jointly operate the Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus as well).

sen.j: また現在は京都定期観光バスに統合され、びわ湖定期観光バスの名称は使用されていない）。
sen.e: At present, it was merged with Kyoto Regular Tour Bus, so the name of Lake Biwa Regular Tour is not use.
At present, it has been merged with the Kyoto Regular Tour Bus, so the name Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus no longer in use.
At present, it has been merged with the Kyoto Regular Tour Bus, so the name Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus no longer in use.

sen.j: びわ湖定期観光バスは大津駅から乗車するものもあった。
sen.e: Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus used to have a line from Otsu Station.
In the past, people would line up from Otsu Station for the Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus.
In the past, people would line up from Otsu Station for the Lake Biwa Regular Tour Bus.

sen.j: また、ジェイティービー主催のサンライズツアーの一環として運行される外国人向けコースについても本項にて紹介する。
sen.e: Also this section introduces the course for foreigners produced by JTB which runs as a part of Sunrise Tours.
This section also introduces a special tour for foreigners produced by JTB which is run as a part of Sunrise Tours.
This section also introduces a special tour for foreigners produced by JTB which is run as a part of Sunrise Tours.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 日本でも指折りの観光地でもある京都における定期観光バスの歴史は長く1927年4月の開業である。
sen.e: The regular tour bus has a long history it was opened in April, 1927 in Kyoto which is one of the most famous sightseeing spot in Japan.
The regular tour bus has a long history and was opened in April, 1927 in Kyoto, which is one of the most famous sightseeing spots in Japan.
The regular tour bus has a long history and was opened in April, 1927 in Kyoto, which is one of the most famous sightseeing spots in Japan.

sen.j: 京都市における定期観光バスの特徴として一番に挙げられるのは、入場料や食事代がセットになっていることから、人気の観光スポットがほぼ待ち時間なしで入場できる点や、個人旅行ではまず入場不可能なところへのコースを設けられていることにある。
sen.e: It prepared as a set with entrance fee and meal, so people are able to get in to the popular sightseeing spot without waiting time, and it makes a course which is not able to enter as individual tour, which is the typical feature of the regular tour bus in Kyoto City.

It prepared as a set with entrance fee and meal, so people are able to get in to the popular sightseeing spot without waiting time, and it makes a course which is not able to enter as individual tour, which is the typical feature of the regular tour bus in Kyoto City.

As the typical features of the regular tour bus in Kyoto City, it is prepared as a set with entrance fee and meal so that people are able to get in to the popular sightseeing spot without waiting time, and it makes a course which is not able to enter as individual tour.
sen.cmt: 意味を明確にするため文章を一部修正しました。

sen.j: その年のさまざまなイベントなどとタイアップしてコースが定められている『京の冬の旅』『京の夏の旅』のコースはそれが最もその特徴が顕著に出ているコースとも言える。
sen.e: The course of "winter tour in Kyoto" and "summer tour in Kyoto" are the most remarkable features, the courses are decided on tie-up with many events of the year.
The most remarkable tours are the "winter tour in Kyoto" and "summer tour in Kyoto" and are included as tie-ups to various events throughout the year.
The most remarkable tours are the "Winter Tour in Kyoto" and "Summer Tour in Kyoto" and are included as tie-ups to various events throughout the year.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション内の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: （経由地については毎年変わるため、公式サイトを確認されること。）
sen.e: (The transits are changed every year, please confirm with official website.)
(The routes change every year, please confirm with the official website.)
(The routes change every year, please confirm with the official website.)

sen.j: 観光資源の豊富な都市だからこその飽きの来ないコース設定などさまざまな経営努力が行われていることもあり、今もなお春や秋の観光シーズンを中心に乗客で賑わっており、活気のある定期観光バスであるといえる。
sen.e: It's able to make exciting courses with the city which has wealthy resources of sightseeing because it makes various effort for management, it bustles with passengers in mainly spring and winter's sightseeing season even now, so it's a vivacious regular tour bus.

The wealth of sightseeing resources allows these tours to never lose their luster, and thanks to this and superb management, the tour is busy with many passengers during the spring and winter sightseeing seasons even now, making for a bustling tour bus
sen.cmt: Robert: This was practically a retranslation, the original made absolutely no sense.
sen.e: The wealth of sightseeing resources allows these tours to never lose their luster, and thanks to this and superb management, the tour is busy with many passengers during the spring and winter sightseeing seasons even now, making for a bustling tour bus.
sen.cmt: 文末のピリオドを追加

sen.j: 現在は、ほぼ全てのコースが京都駅烏丸口の京都駅のバスターミナルから発着する。
sen.e: At present, almost all courses depart from and arrive at bus terminal in Kyoto Station of Karasuma Exit of Kyoto Station.
At present, almost all courses depart from and arrive at the Karamsuma Exit bus terminal in Kyoto Station.
At present, almost all courses depart from and arrive at the Karamsuma Exit bus terminal in Kyoto Station.

sen.j: このうち、8時・9時台に出発する便の一部には、京阪三条駅ならびに京都駅八条口からも出発するが、いずれも京都駅烏丸口定期観光バス乗り場を立ち寄ってから観光コースに入る。
sen.e: Some of these buses which depart from 8:00 to 9:59 depart from Keihan Sanjo Station and Hachijo Exit of Kyoto Station, but both bus stops at the regular tour bus stop of Karasma Exit of Kyoto Station, then goes to the sightseeing course.

Some of the buses which depart from 8:00 to 9:59, do so from Keihan Sanjo Station and Hachijo Exit of Kyoto Station, but both buses stop at the regular tour bus stop at Karasuma Exit, Kyoto Station, before proceeding onward with the tour.

Some of the buses which depart from 8:00 to 9:59, do so from Keihan Sanjo Station and Hachijo Exit of Kyoto Station, but both buses stop at the regular tour bus stop at Karasuma Exit, Kyoto Station, before proceeding onward with the tour.

sen.j: なお、三条京阪前ならびに京都駅八条口には戻らないものがある。
sen.e: But some of these don't return to Sanjo Keihan Mae and Keihan Station Hachijo Exit.
Some of these don't return to Sanjo Keihan Mae or Keihan Station Hachijo Exit.
Some of these don't return to Sanjo Keihan Mae or Hachijo Exit of Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: Keihan Station Hachijo Exit→Hachijo Exit of Kyoto Stationに修正

sen.j: また、琵琶湖方面を観光するコースには京都駅八条口を出発したあとに大津駅で乗降を受け付けるコースもある。
sen.e: Also there is a sightseeing course which goes to Lake Biwa direction approved to get off the bus at Otsu Station, after departures Kyoto Station Hachijo Exit.
Also there is a sightseeing tour for Lake Biwa, whereby passengers connect at Otsu Station after initially departing from Hachijo Exit, Kyoto Station.
Also there is a sightseeing tour for Lake Biwa, whereby passengers connect at Otsu Station after initially departing from Hachijo Exit, Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: Brief history
Brief history
History
sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 1927年(昭和3年)4月18日 京都遊覧乗合自動車営業開始（京都における定期観光バスのはじめ。）
sen.e: April 18, 1927: Kyoto urban normal jadish (Kyoto Sightseeing Bus) started a business (the first regular sightseeing tour bus in Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 京都遊覧乗合自動車→Kyoto uran noriai jidosha(Kyoto Sightseeing Bus)[定訳不明]
sen.e: April 18, 1927: Kyoto urban normal jadish (Kyoto Sightseeing Bus) starts the business (the first regular sightseeing tour bus in Kyoto).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow, Robert: Check "Kyoto urban normal jadish" as it doesn't sound right
sen.e: April 18, 1927: Kyoto Sightseeing Bus starts the business (The first regular sightseeing tour bus in Kyoto.)
sen.cmt: 京都遊覧乗合自動車→「乗合自動車」はバスの別称なので"Kyoto Sightseeing Bus"のみの表記としました。ピリオドの位置を原文表記に合わせ、カッコ内の文頭の頭文字を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 1934年(昭和10年)1月30日 大津近郊遊覧乗合自動車営業開始（琵琶湖地区における定期観光バスのはじめ）
sen.e: January 30, 1934: Otsu Area Sightseeing Bus started a business (the first regular tour bus in Lake Biwa area).
sen.cmt: 大津近郊遊覧乗合自動車→Otsu Area Sightseeing Bus[定訳不明]
sen.e: January 30, 1934: Otsu Area Sightseeing Bus starts as a business (the first regular tour bus in Lake Biwa area).
January 30, 1934: Otsu Area Sightseeing Bus starts as a business (the first regular tour bus in Lake Biwa area)
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、ピリオドを削除

sen.j: 1939年(昭和15年)9月30日 一時休止
sen.e: September 30, 1939: It temporary closed a business.
September 30, 1939: Temporarily closes
September 30, 1939: Temporarily closes

sen.j: 1948年(昭和24年)10月13日 再開
sen.e: October 30, 1948: It restarted a business.
October 30, 1948: Restarts
October 13, 1948: Restarts

sen.j: 1954年(昭和30年)10月10日 京都市営バスとの共同運行開始
sen.e: October 10, 1954: It started a joint service with Kyoto City Bus.
October 10, 1954: Commences joint service with Kyoto City Bus.
October 10, 1954: Commences joint service with Kyoto City Bus
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、ピリオドを削除

sen.j: 1983年(昭和57年)12月15日 定期観光バスとしては初の2階建車両の運行を開始
sen.e: December 15, 1983: It started a service with a double-decker bus as the first regular tour bus.
December 15, 1983: First service of the first double-decker bus employed as a regular tour bus
December 15, 1983: First service of the first double-decker bus employed as a regular tour bus

sen.j: 1986年(昭和61年)5月30日 全国初の女性運転手を採用（のち自然減により廃止）
sen.e: May 15, 1983: It employed the first woman driver in Japan (later, it was abolished naturally).
May 15, 1983: Employed the first female driver in Japan (later, this was abolished naturally).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow, Robert: May want to clarify what "this was abolished naturally" means
sen.e: May 15, 1983: Employs the first female driver in Japan (later, this is abolished naturally)

Summer only tour

sen.j: 外国人向けのコース（サンライズツアー）
sen.e: The course for foreigner (Sunrise Tour)
Tour for foreigners (Sunrise Tour)
Tour for foreigners (Sunrise Tour)

sen.j: JTBが企画する外国人向けのサンライズツアーのコースとして次のコースが運行されている。
sen.e: The following courses run as a course of Sunrise Tour for foreigner which planned by JTB.
The following tours run as a part of Sunrise Tours for foreigners operated by JTB.
The following tours run as a part of Sunrise Tours for foreigners operated by JTB.

sen.j: ガイドは全て英語で行われるため、参加に際してはそのガイドが案内する内容の英語が理解できている必要である。
sen.e: The guide operates all in English, it's necessary to understand all details of the guide in English to join the course.
The entire tour is conducted in English, and as such it is necessary to be able to understand English to join the tour.
The entire tour is conducted in English, and as such it is necessary to be able to understand English to join the tour.

sen.j: （なお、英語が完全に理解できていれば外国人である必要はない。）
sen.e: (It's not necessary to be foreigner if you understand English completely.)
(It's not required that the customer be a foreigner if they understand English completely.)
(It's not required that the customer be a foreigner if they understand English completely.)

sen.j: 二条城・金閣寺・京都御所・京都ハンディクラフトセンター・平安神宮・三十三間堂・清水寺
sen.e: Niji Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace, Kyoto Handcraft Center, Heian Jingu Shrine, Sanjusangendo, Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
Niji Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace, Kyoto Handcraft Center, Heian Jingu Shrine, Sanjusangendo, Kiyomizu-dera Temple.
Kyoto One Day:Nijo-jo Castle, Kinkaku-ji Temple, Kyoto Imperial Palace, Kyoto Handcraft Center, Heian-jingu Shrine, Sanjusangendo, Kiyomizu-dera Temple
sen.cmt: ウェブ上で確認したところ、文頭にコース名"Kyoto 1Day"があったため、訳文に追加しました。Niji Castle→Nijo-jo Castleに修正、Heian-jingu Shrineとしました。文末のピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 上記Kyoto 1Dayのコースのうち、京都ハンディクラフトセンターまで。
sen.e: The one day course of Kyo (details in above) to Kyoto Handicraft Center.
A one day course of Kyo (details in above) to Kyoto Handicraft Center.
Kyoto Morning: Parts of the Kyoto One Day tour listed above to Kyoto Handicraft Center.
sen.cmt: 原文のままでは意味が通じないため、ウェブ上で確認したところ、文頭にツアー名"Kyoto Morning"があったため、訳文に追加し、文章を修正しました。

sen.j: （なお、ハンディクラフトセンターでのみやげ物を贈呈される『Kyoto Morning&ampCraft』なるコースがある。）
sen.e: (Also there is a course "Kyoto Morning & ampCraft" which is presented a souvenir at Handicraft Center.)
(There is also a tour "Kyoto Morning & ampCraft" which is presented as a souvenir at the Handicraft Center.)
(There is also a tour "Kyoto Morning & Craft" in which the tourists can receive a souvenir at the Handicraft Center.)
sen.cmt: "Kyoto Morning & ampCraft"→ウェブ上で確認したところ、"Kyoto Morning & Craft"となっていたためこちらの表記にし、一部訳し直しました。

sen.j: 上記Kyoto 1Dayのコースのうち平安神宮以降のコース。
sen.e: The course except after Heian Jingu Shrine of Kyoto 1 Day course as above.
Parts of the Kyoto 1 day tour listed above following Heian Jingu Shrine.
Kyoto Afternoon: Parts of the Kyoto One Day tour listed above following Heian-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 原文のままでは意味が通じないため、ウェブ上で確認したところ、文頭にツアー名"Kyoto Afternoon"とあったため、訳文に追加しました。Kyoto One Day, Heian-jingu Shrineとしました。

sen.j: その他「京都おこしやす大学」認定コースなどの特別コースも設定される場合がある。

sen.j: 京阪バス洛南営業所に配備されている社番がCで始まる貸切・定期観光バス用の車両が使用される。
sen.e: It uses car of the private and a regular tour bus which is prepared at Rakunan Office of Keihan bus, it started from company number C.
The service uses private and regular tour buses which are marked with the company number C, and are prepared by the Rakunan Office of Keihan bus.
The service uses private and regular tour buses which are marked with the company number C, and are prepared by the Rakunan Office of Keihan bus.

sen.j: （現在は、日野・セレガや三菱ふそう・エアロエースが最も多く使用されている。）

(At present, Hino S'elega and Mitsubishi Fuso Aero Ace are used the most.)
(At present, Hino S'elega and Mitsubishi Fuso Aero Ace are used the most.)

sen.j: 『グランパノラマ』と呼ばれる2階建車両車両は前述に示した☆印のコースに限定されている。

A double-decker bus called "Grand Panorama" which is described above is only used for ? marked bus.
A double-decker bus called "Grand Panorama" which is described above is only used for # marked bus.

sen.e: And small car, Hino Rainbow and Hino Melpha are used only for the course which runs narrow part such as "Nishiyama Sanka".
Also, small form factor vehicles, such as the Hino Rainbow and Hino Melpha are used only for tours which run through narrow parts such as "Nishiyama Sanka".
Also, small form factor vehicles, such as the Hino Rainbow and Hino Melpha are used only for tours which run through narrow parts such as "Nishiyama Sanka."

sen.j: また、サンライズツアー向けの車両は幕の装備の関係で2台（現在は、C-3716・3717の各号車）に限定されている。
sen.e: Also, the car for Sunrise Tour is used limited 2 cars (currently used each C-3716/ 3717) regarding to equipment of curtains.
sen.cmt: 幕の装備の"幕”が分かりませんでした。
sen.e: Also, cars for the Sunrise Tour is limited to two (currently C-3716/ 3717) due to curtains equipped on the vehicles.
Also, cars for the Sunrise Tour is limited to two (currently C-3716/ 3717) due to curtains equipped on the vehicles.

sen.j: （但し、運休日には一般コースでの運行がある。）
sen.e: (But, it runs as typical course on cancelled day)
(Howver, the vehicles operate on a general tour during off-days)

sen.j: それ以外の車両については、後述の京都市交通局の車両、ならびに京阪京都交通などの応援車を含めて共通運用されている。
sen.e: The cars except these are managed with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau which describe below and Keihan Kyoto Kotsu which includes the support car.
All cars except those mentioned above are managed by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau, described below, and Keihan Kyoto Kotsu, including support cars.
All cars except those mentioned above are managed by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau, described below, and Keihan Kyoto Kotsu, including support cars.

sen.j: なお、かつては一般路線バスに入るバスのうち、座席が比較的豪華なものを使用していたワンロマ車についても使用されていた。
sen.e: Also it was used for Oneroma Car with relatively gorgeous seat among the bus which runs regular road.
Also it was used for Oneroma Car with relatively gorgeous seat among the bus which runs regular road.
In addition, the bus called One-roma Car with relatively gorgeous seat among the buses that ran regular roads used to be used as well.
sen.cmt: 原文の内容に沿わないため、全体を修正しました。

sen.j: 京都市営バス梅津営業所に配備されているファンタスティックバス『京のぞみちゃん号』と呼ばれる日野自動車製のシャシーに東京特殊車体による架装を施されたものと、いすゞ自動車製のいすゞ・ガーラの4台が使用される。
sen.e: It uses 4 cars, Fantastic Bus called "Kyo Nozomi-chan Go" made by Hino Motors on the chassis, and equipped by Tokyo special car, and Isuzu Gala made by Isuzu Motors are prepared at Umezu Office of Kyoto City Bus.

Four buses are used, a Fantastic Bus called "Kyo Nozomi-chan Go," chassis made by Hino Motors, and equipped by Tokyo special car, and the Isuzu Gala made by Isuzu Motors and prepared by Umezu Office of Kyoto City Bus.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow, Robert: Still makes little sense
sen.e: The service uses a car called the Fantastic Bus "Kyo Nozomi-chan Go," chassis made by Hino Motors and equipped by the Tokyo Special Coach Manufacture company, and four Isuzu Gala cars made by Isuzu Motors, which are prepared by Umezu Office of Kyoto City Bus.
sen.cmt: 合計4台ではなく、『京のぞみちゃん号』1台、いすゞ・ガーラが4台であると思われます。原文の内容に沿うよう訳文を一部修正しました。「東京特殊車体」→Tokyo Special Coach Manufacture companyとしました。(参照: http://www.toutoku.co.jp/)

sen.j: 『京のぞみちゃん号』については、充当されるコースが限定されているため詳しくは公式サイトを参照されたし。
sen.e: Please check official website for "Kyo Nozomi-chan Go", because the course which applied are limited.
Please check the official website for "Kyo Nozomi-chan Go", as tours are limited.
Please check the official website for "Kyo Nozomi-chan Go", as tours are limited.

sen.j: 京阪バスグループによる応援
sen.e: Support from Keihan Bus Group
Support from Keihan Bus Group
Support from Keihan Bus Group

sen.j: 秋の行楽シーズンなどの乗客が多い時期には京阪京都交通から貸切・高速専用車が応援で使用されることがある（なお、これはかつての京都交通 (亀岡)時代から行っている）。
sen.e: A private car and a highway specialized car are used as support from Keihan Kyoto Kotsu during the sightseeing season on fall when the passengers increase (it was operated since it used to be Kyoto Kotsu (when it was Kameoka)).

A private car and a specialized highway car are used as extra support by Keihan Kyoto Kotsu during the sightseeing season in the fall when the number of passengers peak (this has been ongoing since it used to be a part of Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka)).

A private car and a specialized highway car are used as extra support by Keihan Kyoto Kotsu during the sightseeing season in the fall when the number of passengers peak (this has been ongoing since it used to be a part of Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka)).

sen.j: また、京阪京都交通車の貸切・高速専用車は台数が少ないため、それでも捌き切れない場合は台数に比較的余裕のある京阪宇治バスの貸切登録車両も応援に入る（ただし一般路線でも使用するワンロマ車および路線・貸切兼用車は定期観光バスの運用には入らない）。
sen.e: Also Keihan Kyoto Kotsu doesn't own many private cars and the highway exclusive car, the registered private car of Keihan Uji which relatively has many cars supports them when they need an extra (but, the One-roma car which runs on regular street and the car for a street and private use, doesn't manage the regular sightseeing tour bus).

Also since Keihan Kyoto Kotsu doesn't own many private cars or specialized highway cars, the registered private car of Keihan Uji which relatively has many cars supports them when they need an extra (but, the One-roma car which runs on regular street and the car for a street and private use, doesn't manage the regular sightseeing tour bus).
sen.cmt: Robert: Tried to edit, but makes almost no sense.
sen.e: Also since Keihan Kyoto Kotsu doesn't own many private cars or specialized highway cars, the registered private car of Keihan Uji which relatively has many cars supports them when they need an extra (but, the One-roma car which runs on regular street and the car for a street and private use, doesn't manage the regular sightseeing tour bus).

sen.j: スカイバス京都
sen.e: Skybus Kyoto
Skybus Kyoto
Skybus Kyoto

sen.j: 2007年10月4日よりネオプラン・スペースライナーのオープントップバスを使用した「スカイバス京都」（SKYバスとも称する）を京都定期観光バスで運行を開始した。
sen.e: Skytbus Kyoto' (also called SKY bus) which uses open-top bus of Neo Plan/Space Liner started service as Kyoto Regular Tour Bus.
Skytbus Kyoto' (also called SKY bus) uses an open-top bus by Neo Plan/Space Liner, which started service in October 4th, 2007 and is operated by the Kyoto Regular Tour Bus.
Skytbus Kyoto' (also called SKY bus) uses an open-top bus by Neo Plan/Space Liner, which started service in October 4th, 2007 and is operated by the Kyoto Regular Tour Bus.

sen.j: 京阪バスでの運行である。
sen.e: It runs as Keihan Bus.
It is operated under Keihan Bus.
It is operated under Keihan Bus.

sen.j: ただし運転可能な運転手は通常の定期観光バスと違い、洛南営業所およびその支所である横大路支所（横大路は京都市営バス委託の京阪バスの営業所）の優秀クラスの運転手しか行わない。
sen.e: But the drivers who are able to drive are different from normal regular tour bus, only drivers with excellent class from Rakunan Office and Yokooji Office which is branch of Rakunan Office are able to drive.
However, only top drivers from the Rakunan Office or Yokooji Office which is a branch of the Rakunan Office are able to drive, which differs from typical regular tour buses.
However, only top drivers from the Rakunan Office or Yokooji Office which is a branch of the Rakunan Office are able to drive, which differs from typical regular tour buses.

sen.j: 車両所属は正式には日の丸自動車興業板橋営業所（東京都板橋区）であるが、レンタル期間中は京阪バス洛南営業所に配置されている。
sen.e: The car officially belong to Hinomaru Limousine Itabashi Office (Itabashi-ku, Tokyo), but it's placed at Keihan Bus Rakunan Office during rental.
The vehicle officially belongs to Hinomaru Limousine Itabashi Office (Itabashi-ku, Tokyo), but is placed at the Keihan Bus Rakunan Office when available for rent.
The vehicle officially belongs to Hinomaru Limousine Itabashi Office (Itabashi Ward, Tokyo), but is placed at the Keihan Bus Rakunan Office when available for rent.

sen.j: 冬季の運行は2008年1月6日に好評のうちに終了した。
sen.e: The winter service was ended successfully in January 6, 2008.
The winter service ended successfully in January 6, 2008.
The winter service ended successfully in January 6, 2008.

sen.j: これを受けて、同年3月20日より春の運行が行われている（4月13日まで『桜コース』を、4月14日から6月8日までは『新緑コース』を運行）
sen.e: Because of that, it operated the spring service from March 20, 2008, ("Sakura Course" until April 13, "Shinryoku Course" from April 14 to June 8 were operated).
Because of this, spring service commenced from March 20, 2008, ("Sakura Course" until April 13, operated as "Shinryoku Course" from April 14 to June 8).
Because of this, spring service commenced from March 20, 2008, ("Sakura Course" until April 13, operated as "Shinryoku Course" from April 14 to June 8).

sen.j: これに先立ち、東山花行路2008のイベントにタイアップしたコースを無料で運行を行った。
sen.e: Before that, it operated a free course which is tie-up with event of Higashiyama hanakoro 2008.
Before that, it operated a free route which tied-in with Higashiyama hanakoro 2008.
Before that, it operated a free route which tied-in with Higashiyama hanakoro 2008.

sen.j: また、春の運行より夕刻の1便に英語のみによるアナウンスが行われる便の設定がある。
sen.e: Also there is an afternoon bus which has an announcement with English from spring service.
Also, there is an afternoon bus which provides English language announcement during spring service.
Also, there is an afternoon bus which provides English language announcement during spring service.

Kyoto City Bus Umezu Office (only city employees are able to drive regular tour buses)

sen.e: Kyoto City Bus Gojo Office used to be in charge of it, but it changed to Umezu for abolishment of the office.
Kyoto City Bus Gojo Office used to be in charge, but changed to Umezu due to the office being abolished.
Kyoto City Bus Gojo Office used to be in charge, but changed to Umezu due to the office being abolished.

sen.j: 京阪バス洛南営業所（京阪バス全11営業所の優秀クラスの運転手のみ運転可能）
sen.e: Keihan Bus Rakunan Office (Only excellent class drivers are able to drive in all of 11 offices of Keihan Bus)
Keihan Bus Rakunan Office (Only top drivers are able to drive in all 11 offices of Keihan Bus)
Keihan Bus Rakunan Office (Only top drivers are able to drive in all 11 offices of Keihan Bus)

sen.j: 1985年12月までは、京阪バス大津営業所、京阪バス山科営業所（当時は京都）、洛南の3営業所が共管していたが、洛南に統一された。
sen.e: Keihan Bus Otsu Office, Keihan Bus Yamashina Office (it was Kyoto at that time), and Rakunan used to co-managed until December 1985, but it merged to Rakunan.
Keihan Bus Otsu Office, Keihan Bus Yamashina Office (it was Kyoto at that time), and Rakunan used to be co-managed until December 1985, but merged to form Rakunan.
Keihan Bus Otsu Office, Keihan Bus Yamashina Office (it was Kyoto at that time), and Rakunan Office used to be co-managed until December 1985, but merged to form Rakunan Office.

sen.j: なお1966年2月までは京阪バス大津定期遊覧営業所が大津駅付近に位置していたが、大津営業所（2代）に統合され廃止され、移転後は大津定期遊覧営業所管轄便は大津営業所が担当するようになった。
sen.e: Keihan Bus Otsu Regular Tour Office located at near Otsu Station until February 1966, but it abolished and merged to Otsu Office (the second office), Otsu Office became in charge of the route of Otsu Regular Tour Office after the relocation.

Keihan Bus Otsu Regular Tour Office was located near Otsu Station until February 1966, but was later abolished and merged with Otsu Office (the second office), Otsu Office was charged with the route of Otsu Regular Tour Office after the relocation.

Keihan Bus Otsu Regular Tour Office was located near Otsu Station until February 1966, but was later abolished and merged with Otsu Office (the second office), Otsu Office was charged with the route of Otsu Regular Tour Office after the relocation.

Choro Q was sold to commemorate 80 years of service by the Kyoto Regular Tour Bus in April 18, 2008.
Choro Q was sold to commemorate 80 years of service by the Kyoto Regular Tour Bus in April 18, 2008.

sen.j: 京都市交通局と京阪バスの車両が1台ずつの2台セットである。
